item.title: তুমি আমি
item.description:
– এই যে…

– পেছনে তাকিয়ে দেখি কেয়া ডাকছে। আমি মিষ্টি হাসি দিয়ে বললাম- জি জি। আমার মিষ্টি হাসি কেয়ার পছন্দ হয়নি। তার ভ্রু কুঁচকে গেছে।

– মাথার চুল কই?

– নাপিত কেটে দিছে।

– নাপিত আপনাকে বাসা থেকে ডেকে নিয়ে গেছে?

– না। আমি সেধে গেছি।

– কেন গেছেন?

– মাথা কামাতে।

– আপনাকে আমি নিষেধ করছিলাম মাথা ন্যাড়া না করতে।

– ভুলে গেছিলাম। নেক্সট টাইম মনে রাখার চেষ্টা করব।

– মোটেও আপনি করবেন না। আপনি আপনার মনে চাইলেই আবার মাথা ন্যাড়া করে ঘুরবেন।

মেয়েটার সাথে কথায় পারা যাবে না। কারণ কথা সত্য। আমি আবারও মাথা ন্যাড়া করে ঘুরব। কিন্তু এটা যে সত্য কথা সেটা ওকে বুঝতে দেয়া যাবে না। বরং এমন কথা বলতে হবে যাতে ও খুশি হয়।

– আমার সাথে একটু হাঁটবা?

– আমার সময় নেই।

– অল্প সময় হাঁটলেই হবে।

– না, আমি আপনার সাথে হাঁটব না।

– আচ্ছা ঠিক আছে। তাহলে আমার সামনে সামনে হাঁটো। আমি অল্প সময় তোমার পিছন পিছন হেঁটে চলে যাব। – মিথ্যা কথা বলবেন না। আপনি মোটেও আমার পিছনে হাটবেন না।

– অল্প হাঁটব।

– আপনি মিথ্যা বলেন। আপনি অল্পও হাটবেন না।

– আমি তাহলে একা হাঁটতে যাই?

– আপনার পা খালি কেন?

– খালি পায়ে বের হলে তোমার সাথে দেখা হয়।

– মিথ্যাবাদী।

আমি হাসি দিলাম। এটা আগের হাসি থেকেও মিষ্টি হাসি ছিল। কেয়ার ভ্রু আগের চেয়ে বেশি কুঁচকে গেল। আমার মিষ্টি হাসি একটা কুফা।

– আপনি এগুলো করে কি প্রমাণ করতে চান আপনি মহাপুরুষ?

– না তো। – মাথা কামিয়ে, খালি পায়ে রাস্তায় হেঁটে মহাপুরুষ হওয়া যায় না। বড়জোর পাগল হওয়া যায়।

আমার পাগল হবারও ইচ্ছা আছে। মাথা কামিয়ে, খালি পায়ে হেটে পাগল হওয়া গেলে আমি প্রতি বছরের একটা নির্দিষ্ট সময় পর্যন্ত পাগল হতাম। তবে কেয়াকে এটা বলা যাবে না। মেয়েটার চোখ টলমল করছে। আকাশে মেঘ ডাকছে। যে কোন সময় বৃষ্টি নামবে।



‪অল্পসল্পগল্প
৭ শ্রাবণ ১৪২২

item.title: This is Just the Begining!!
item.description:
Hello Friends, Its been a small journey of only 5,25,600 minutes. And I still feel like its just the begining.

We recently concluded branding for Find Your Calling (FYC), an initiative of CareerBuilder child company EMSI, that offers free, user-friendly access to a tremendous database of labor market, job posting, and education data to help students and their parents make data-informed (economic) decisions about their future career paths.

I had the joy of conceptualizing, styling, and shooting the case study.

FYC’s brand is one of light, hope, energy, and youthfulness. Plugging students into fulfilling career paths… that’s pretty aspirational. I wanted to expound on that feeling. But how?

After conceptualizing, it was apparent that the feeling of hope — of a mission — is uplifting. How better to visualize that feeling other than through floating? The concept was born.

item.title: Wordpress Sequrity
item.description:
Letest Trands. You’ve probably browsed our portfolio, and you’ve almost certainly seen our Dribbbling. But have you noticed what we’re NOT showing? What’s the saying about how the cobbler’s children have no shoes?

Since I spend most of my production time in the UI world, I’m very sensitive to having our UI work get the attention it deserves. Not merely from an outcomes standpoint but especially from a process standpoint, because that’s where the foundation for creating value is laid.

Our portfolio does an excellent job of showcasing our stellar branding work and our extensive brand strategy process, but we haven’t done much in the way of illustrating our experience and interface design work.

And so, in an effort to move toward that, we give you but a brief visual look at some recent projects from our UI team. Take a look at our work and let us know how we can help you with your UI needs.

Click here to view our recent UI work.

item.title: In the Studio: Find Your Calling
item.description:
We recently concluded branding for Find Your Calling (FYC), an initiative of CareerBuilder child company EMSI, that offers free, user-friendly access to a tremendous database of labor market, job posting, and education data to help students and their parents make data-informed (economic) decisions about their future career paths.

I had the joy of conceptualizing, styling, and shooting the case study.

FYC’s brand is one of light, hope, energy, and youthfulness. Plugging students into fulfilling career paths… that’s pretty aspirational. I wanted to expound on that feeling. But how?

After conceptualizing, it was apparent that the feeling of hope — of a mission — is uplifting. How better to visualize that feeling other than through floating? The concept was born.

After selecting three professions, the process of styling, shooting, and retouching began.

After selecting three professions, the process of styling, shooting, and retouching began.

item.title: The Client Perspective: Charley Todd of Ted Todd Insurance
item.description:
We’re excited to publish the first of many guest blog posts. The idea? To let our clients tell you about their experiences working with Focus Lab. Kicking us off is Charley Todd, CIO of Ted Todd Insurance, an awesome, energetic, and longstanding client of ours.

Don Draper and Matthew Weiner’s entire cast of Mad Men have compelled American audiences for nearly a decade. Consider me one of the ultra-engaged Sunday night viewers obsessed with the goings-on at Sterling Cooper, right up until Sunday’s series finale. However, as much fun as watching fictional creatives has been, working with the actual designers, thinkers, and artists from Focus Lab has been absolutely transformational.

I first discovered our company’s real life “Don” in the person of Bill Kenney. I stumbled upon a website called Dribbble that showcases thousands of artists and their work. I became magnetized to the designs in Bill’s portfolio and I still remember nervously messaging him for the first time to see if his schedule allowed for any new client work. Fast-forward to 2015 and we’ve successfully used Bill and Erik’s team to:

Throughout our business relationship with Focus Lab, the financial gain and competitive advantages we’ve benefited from are outstanding and easy to document. But that’s not what has made me a truly passionate supporter of their work. What sold me on Bill and Erik’s company is, well, to put it simply: Bill and Erik. The rarity of finding leaders who attract genuine and transparent talent around them while simultaneously staying grounded themselves cannot be overstated.

One of the most memorable moments of Mad Men’s series happens between arguably the two most interesting characters. Peggy confronts Don on her perceived lack of being valued for her creative work and her mistreatment by Draper as her direct supervisor. Don’s temper rises as he proclaims, “That’s what the money’s for!”

Thankfully what Focus Lab understands at its core is that money and profits are only part of the equation. Money wasn’t enough of an answer for Peggy and it shouldn’t have been. People are the most important ingredient in business and in — life. Our partnership with Bill, Erik, and their entire team speaks to that belief. High-end talent with genuine and personal communication — that’s what we found in Savannah three years ago. That’s what we’re excited to continually partner with in the future.
